content: of live stitches in stockinette you know what you re getting yourself into hood section pattern instructions co 64 stitches cowl section knit 10 row in stockinette starting with a knit row to create pouch for drawstring choice #1 three needle bind off with purl side still facing pick up 64 stitches from cast on 49 stitches using your preferred cast on bottom right hand corner of cast on edge turn work and hold both needles together with live knit in stockinette stitch for 20 inches unstretched stitches in front knit stitches from both needles end with a knit row together across the row seaming with a three needle bind off purl 1 row and then continue in stockinette until without turning work meaning with the knit side of knitting measures 10-12 inches across in total your work still facing you take your extra needle and depending on how deep you would like your hood starting at the bottom right hand corner of your cast on edge pick up 49 stitches along the cast on edge hood shaping hold each needle next to each other with the live next row knit 30 st slip the next 2 sts knitwise and stitches in front like this then knit them together ssk knit the next two stitches together k2tog knit 30 st row 2 purl across repeat these two row one more time changing the knit 30 sts before and after the decreases to knit 29 sts to seam hood knit 1 more row with purl side facing fold work and your circular needle in half and rearrange stitches so page 2 there are 32 sts on the front needle and 32 sts on the cross to the cowl side pick up bar and then return to back needle using your spare needle knit these the hood put needle into same space it came from stitches together as you bind off following the pictures and pick up the next bar continue like this making for the three needle bind off given for the cowl sure to match row ** tighten yarn every four or five stitches when you get to the drawtsring pouch make to graft hood sure to seam only one side of the pouch - do not seam it closed when complete return to the center seam fold knitting in half so you have half the stitches on and use yarn tail to repeat seaming in the other the front part of your circular needle and half on the direction back needle graft closed in stockinette ** if you knit a deep hood you will need to make up the finishing instructions difference between the hood and cowl try alternating between seaming like normal one bar from each side and seaming with 2 bars on the hood and 1 bar on the cowl drawstring there are a few options for your drawstring i made my drawstring by knitting i-cord on 2 stitches on size 10 double pointed needles and working
